result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael J Webb was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Intent. Contribute/Delinquency Child, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 948.40(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Pay $100.00 fine plus costs.   If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment may be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.
----------------------------

Pursuant to sec. 973.046(1r), the defendant is required to pay $200.00 DNA surcharge.
------------------------------

Possess no firearms. Possess no weapons.
---------------------------

Counseling as recommended by Probation Agent.  The defendant must pay Department of Corrections Supervision fees.
--------------------------

Pay restitution in the amount of $9655.12. Defendant stipulates to restitution of $3119.12. Balance of $6536.00 subject to challenge within 60 days.
----------------------
**AMENDMENT 05-28-2015 - PURSUANT TO ORDER SIGNED ON 05-26-2015, restitution is ordered in the amount of $5,000.00 joint and several with any co-actor.
----------------------

judgments.dispoDesc: CORRECTED JUDGMENT - 5-19-2015 - To reflect Guilty No Contest Plea
judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea
